Title: Senior Software Test Engineer
Job_Description:
In establishing itself as the No. 1 coffee brand in the UK, Costa pioneered technology to deliver great consumer experiences through high-end vending. We know that the next frontier of consumer retail experiences will be delivered through automated retail and Costa Austin has been on the cutting edge for more than 10 years. Automation is one of the most exciting global trends, forecasted to grow at a 10%+ annual rate. We are building an innovative new connected platform that combines robotics, smart data analytics, and digital consumer experience; we are crafting the future of coffee retailing as we drive towards our vision for Costa to become the Worlds Most Loved Coffee company to life. While moving at the pace consistent with our Austin startup DNA, as part of the Coca-Cola company we have the resources and knowledge to make it happen!
If you love innovative technology and coffee, this is a great opportunity for you. You'll be working with a passionate and growing cross-functional team to fundamentally improve the morning ritual of other coffee lovers around the globe.
Team Communication; Software Testing; Programming Languages; Software Development; Automated Testing; Computer Coding

Title: Senior Software Test Engineer
Job_Description:
At The Coca-Cola Company, we're looking for individuals who understand the fundamentals and principles of technology and want to solve business problems on a global scale. As a Software Engineering Manager, you will lead multiple agile teams which deliver features and systems that power our next generation intelligent platforms. In this role you will have the opportunity to lead development efforts for enterprise applications, launch them, operate them, and continue to develop them. You are the leader of several engineering initiatives, driving success through your direct and indirect reports and business partners. You manage cross-functional teams of software engineers, test engineers, architects and product owners. You have a passion for coaching and mentoring to help individuals grow and you are obsessed with providing a great product experience, always looking for new opportunities to improve.
What You’ll Do for Us
Manage a team of talented technology professionals to motivate them, direct, and promote positive culture for the success of the organization

Title: Senior Developer
Job_Description:
Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home.
At Swire Coca-Cola, our commitment to excellence is what guides our actions with our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time associates which includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays and Company Discounts.

What does an Applications Developer do at Swire Coca-Cola?

As an Application Developer you will create and maintain programs, either on premise or cloud based. You will be assigned work based on the need from the organization as requested in the work intake process. You will be responsible for developing any applications, stored procedures, data tables, Microsoft Power Apps, and interfaces as the need arises. The general focus will be Web Based Development using, though there may also be on premise applications and Microsoft Power Apps that may need to be created or maintained. This position is expected to communicate with the DevOps, Data Warehouse, and Data Governance teams to ensure that the best solution is created. Documentation and training may also be performed by this position ensuring that the end user benefits from the best product possible in a timely fashion and you will work with the DevOps manager to help prioritize their workload.

Job_Description:
Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home.

What does a Network Engineer do at Swire Coca-Cola?

In this role you are responsible for implementing, managing, and monitoring all aspects of our internal, local, wireless, wide area data and voice networks to ensure maximum uptime for systems and users. The role includes assisting in the design of network systems and configurations, documenting and managing the installation of new and existing networks, and monitoring network performance while maintaining and upgrading existing systems, as necessary.

The Coca-Cola Freestyle Innovation Center’s Engineering team is growing and is looking for a Principal Engineer to continue our success! The Principal Engineer will join the Fluidic Sub-Systems Team and be responsible for the design and development of fluid handling systems that pour quality Coca-Cola brands on our Freestyle dispensers. Our ideal candidate will seek to understand customer needs, design and improve unique products, and put them into production through our internal process.
What You'll Do For Us
Lead cross-functional teams to develop and commercialize new Freestyle dispensers and technologies.
Design systems and components that manage fluid flow, including pumping technologies, nozzles, and flow through tubes and valves throughout the engineering lifecycle.

Title: Data Developer

Tasks:
Partner with business and technical stakeholders across the organization to translate challenging business problems into impactful data science solutions

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
What we want to accomplish and why we need you?
Haptik is one of the world's largest Conversational AI companies, having reached over 100 million devices, and processed over 4 billion conversations till date. Haptik has been at the forefront of the paradigm shift of interaction from clicks to conversations. We have built a robust set of technology and tools that can enable any kind of conversational application. With a 250 member strong team that is set to double in the coming year, Haptik is truly poised to lead the Conversational AI revolution with some of the best minds in the industry.
We are currently looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated Analyst. The ideal candidate will have strong attention to detail, a sense of ownership, a positive attitude, and a willingness to get clients onboarded on the Haptik platform in the Conversational AI space.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
What we want to accomplish and why we need you?

Haptik is one of the world's largest Conversational AI companies, having reached over 500+ million devices, and processed over 4 billion conversations till date. Haptik has been at the forefront of the paradigm shift of interaction from clicks to conversations. We have built a robust set of technology and tools that can enable any kind of conversational application. With a 300+ member strong team that is set to double in the coming year, Haptik is truly poised to lead the Conversational AI revolution with some of the best minds in the industry.
We are a full-stack conversational AI company from building products to delivering bots for our clients. We are looking for a “DevOps Implementation Engineer” to believe in this mission and take care of our systems, architecture, and DevOps culture.

What will you do every day?

You will be building, managing and maintaining large scale systems and architecture for our platform. The platform spans over multiple services/microservices which run on fully container orchestrated environments. You will be playing a key role in shaping the architecture of the company that is growing exponentially. We aim to have a fast, agile and automated DevOps philosophy that will provide a world-class experience to our users with minimal or zero downtime.

Ok, you're sold, but what are we looking for in the perfect candidate?
Own all the existing cloud infrastructure (AWS – EC2, RDS, Elasticache and much more, GCP, Azure)
Implement pipelines to automate deployment and scaling
Build a Security-first architecture
Assist development teams with any infrastructure needs & technical support
Available 24×7 for any production issues (Site Reliability)
Perform root cause analysis for production errors
Ability to research & implement new technologies to scale the Haptik Systems end to end
Create and maintain backlog on JIRA
Implement security philosophies to build a bulletproof system
Help with cost optimizations of infrastructure
Mentor, motivate and inspire your team by providing regular feedback and working closely with them to align their personal goals with that of the entire team
Knowledge Sharing

Requirements*
3-5 years of work experience as a DevOps Implementation Engineer or similar software engineering role
Sound knowledge of Kubernetes and similar orchestration methodologies for Containers
Significant technical, automation, and programming experience throughout the full lifecycle enterprise SDLC.
A comprehensive understanding of enterprise software development tools and methodologies, including typical enterprise application architectures and the ability to write scripted or compiled application and automation code.
Hands-on experience with AWS services (EC2, VPC, RDS, Route53, and others)
Worked with next-gen infrastructure & application monitoring, Service discovery tools (Grafana, Prometheus, Zabbix, New Relic, Consul, etc.)
Inquisitive nature & Self-starter who can implement with minimal guidance
Experience with DevOps techniques and philosophies
Experience with deploying and maintaining high traffic infrastructure (performance testing is a plus)
Extensive hands-on experience with SQL databases and NoSQL is a plus
Expert with scripting languages (high five on python and/or shell)
Experience with configuration management at the scale of over 100 servers
( Ansible/Puppet/Chef etc.) & Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
This role provides you access to the Personally Identifiable Information or Protected health information for which you will be abide to follow secure data handling practices to safeguard and protect such data.

Tell me more about Haptik
Announced major strategic partnership in April 2019 with Jio in a $100 million deal.
You will be working with great leaders who have been listed in Business World 40 Under 40, Forbes 30 Under 30 and MIT 35 Under 35 Innovators.
The freedom to think and innovate is something that defines the culture of Haptik. Every person is approachable. While we are working hard, it is also important to take breaks to not get too worked up.
Disrupting a massive, growing AI market. The global market is projected to attain a valuation of $9 billion by the end of 2024.
We are moving to an AI first world, and Haptik is one of the largest AI first companies globally, based out of India.
Some of the most notable brands in the world - Oyo Rooms, Samsung, Tata Teleservices, Club Mahindra, KFC, Coca-Cola, to count a few.
A fun and exciting start-up culture that empowers its people to make a huge impact.

Working hard for things that we don't care about is stress, but working hard for something we love is called passion! At Haptik we passionately solve problems in order to be able to move faster and each Haptikan imbibes our key values of honesty, ownership, perseverance, communication, impact, curiosity, courage, agility and selflessness.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
What we want to accomplish and why we need you?

Haptik is one of the world's largest Conversational AI companies, having reached over 550+ million devices, and processed over 5+billion conversations till date. Haptik has been at the forefront of the paradigm shift of interaction from clicks to conversations. We have built a robust set of technology and tools that can enable any kind of conversational application. With a 390+ member strong team, including some of the finest minds in Artificial Intelligence, Haptik is truly poised to lead the Conversational AI revolution. Haptik’s conversational AI platform currently supports training for more than 500 NLU models and inference for more than 2 million messages everyday. We are currently looking to grow our Machine Learning team to strengthen and expand multiple research projects in the domain of information retrieval, multi-turn dialogue understanding, personalising chatbots with emotions and personality, monitoring conversations to measure business impact. As a Senior Engineering Manager, you will be leading the team of Machine Learning Engineers devise training and prediction pipelines at scale using best engineering practices. You’ll get ample opportunities to solve complex ML problems which will improve NLU of Haptik’s Conversational AI platform.

Haptik's hybrid work model

What will you do every day?

You will lead a highly self-motivated and independent team which finds pleasure in dealing with complexity of scaling ML platform and enjoys simplifying the ambiguity underlying Natural Language Understanding.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Sr. Data Scientist, Machine Learning
In this two part blog “The future (of Employee Experience) is Converational” (Part 1 - Understanding the language barrier between people and machines, Part 2 - How machines learned the secrets of language, we discussed a vision for the future of employee experience using Conversational AI. Through the years, we have built a range of enterprise applications on the foundation of a robust conversation system powered by AI/NLP. Now we are seeking seasoned Data Scientists to help shape the future of conversational AI with data rigor.
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, natural language process, online experimentation, and quantitative methods. In addition, hands-on ability to push production code with sound engineering fundamentals would be nice to have. You will collaborate closely with a vibrant cross-functional team (ML engineers, data engineers, designers and product managers).

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry
At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.
Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we're building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you're ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.
Instacart is a Flex First team

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
We are looking for a passionate DevOps engineer to join our team. As a member of the DevOps team, you will be responsible for architecting and managing Moveworks AI cloud infrastructure and strategy. As Moveworks grows fast, the DevOps team is tasked with designing and operating resilient and secure cloud and CI/CD infrastructure that allows our product to operate reliably and our engineering teams to build and release customer facing features very rapidly.
We’re building a team that indexes on moving fast, solving challenging product/engineering problems and providing value to our customers. To be successful, you'll be partnering with infrastructure, machine learning, search, data, and full stack teams to identify their DevOps and infrastructure needs and build elegant solutions. This is an opportunity to play an integral role at the fastest-growing AI startup in its space.
Who we are:

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Location:
Remote (USA)
About DispatchTrack
DispatchTrack is the leading solution provider of right-time delivery management software, helping top brands around the globe power successful deliveries 180 million times a year. Since 2010, DispatchTrack’s scalable SaaS platform has made delivery organizations more connected, agile, and intelligent, using highly-configurable capabilities designed to empower better delivery management from end to end. Our proprietary AI-powered routing algorithm ensures 98% ETA accuracy in last-mile deliveries. We’re constantly innovating to improve performance and better serve our 2,000+ customers, including Wal-Mart, Coca-Cola, Ashley, Ferguson Enterprises, and many others. When businesses make promises to their customers—DispatchTrack makes sure they deliver. Promise. Deliver. Delight.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
We’re looking for a passionate, experienced Software Engineer to join our team. This role plays an essential part of the Moveworks AI product ecosystem. The ability to leverage ML intelligence for the fullstack makes it innovative and fun! You’ll have a different playground to work on web UI here. Your work will impact every customer and the productivity of cross-functional teams at Moveworks. In other words, we needed you here yesterday!
This role at Moveworks is unlike most other fullstack roles and encompasses a variety of projects across the entire company. As Conversational UI is more limited than Web UI, and chat adoption level varies for each customer, you will be building out a hybrid UI with both Chat and Web to deliver the optimal end-user experience. Additionally, you will be taking our Production Admin UI to the next level, to scale our enterprise customer base fast. Last, (but not finally) you will be building out a data and annotation tooling pipeline, which is key in ML training and feedback loops for our product development. You will be deeply involved in design and shipping code daily and will see the immediate impact of your work. This is an opportunity to play an integral role at the fastest-growing AI startup in its space.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Customer Success Engineer
As a Customer Success Engineer at Moveworks, you'll work alongside a Customer Success Manager to understand customer requirements and drive all technical aspects of the post-sales engagement with customers. In essence, you are responsible for the technical delivery of the Moveworks platform. This involves activities such as: validating proper access to customer infrastructure for API integrations, configuring the behavior of the Moveworks platform using configuration files, and advising customers on how they can modify their systems to optimize performance of the Moveworks platform.
You will play an advisory role to early customers, build long-term strategic relationships with both customers and partners, and ensure optimal customer experience and outcomes. Each of our team members is extremely hands-on, pushes boundaries, and is driven to deliver their best work. Because of this, you'll be the technical customer advocate internally, and have the opportunity to work closely with Product Management, Engineering and R&D teams and help to influence the product features based on feedback from customers.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description
As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to translate prototypes into scalable solutions. You will build, ship, run and monitor Coca-Cola’s global ML & AI solutions bridging the gap between Data Scientists and Operations. You will ensure that models conform to the ML strategy and guidance established by the Coca-Cola Data Science team. You should be proficient at building, training, deploying, and monitoring ML models on the Azure platform including Azure Machine Learning service and Synapse.
Responsibilities for Senior Data Engineer
Wrap models in a scoring function for an API or a scheduled batch run, wrapping a model in a simple web interface, ensuring appropriate logging for monitoring/observability, crafting documentation for HLA and API specs, configuring Docker/Kubernetes, etc.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
What we want to accomplish and why we need you?

Haptik is one of the world’s largest Conversational AI companies, having reached over 550+ million devices, and processed over 4.5+ billion conversations till date. Haptik has been at the forefront of the paradigm shift of interaction from clicks to conversations. We have built a robust set of technology and tools that can enable any kind of conversational application.

With a 350+ member strong team, Haptik is truly poised to lead the Conversational AI revolution with some of the best minds in the industry. We want to be the most admired brand globally when it comes to enterprise conversational AI. We deeply care about building the right solutions for our clients and ensure they get the desired value from our technology.

Haptik's hybrid work model
Haptik plans to operate in a hybrid work-model where our employees will have the flexibility to Work-from-Home (WFH) for up to 3 out of 5 working days every week.
In addition to Mumbai where we already have an office, places like Bangalore, Delhi/NCR and Pune will also have an office space soon in 2022 as many of our current employees are also based in these cities.
You’re encouraged to apply only if you’re either based in one of these 4 cities (Mumbai, Bangalore, Delhi, Pune) or are open to relocating to one within 6 months of joining us.

What will you do every day?

As a Senior product manager, you are responsible for managing the entire product lifecycle end-to-end. You will proactively identify initiatives to drive value to customers based on your area of focus. You will champion these features across multiple teams - machine learning, design, engineering, marketing, sales, marketing, customer success to deliver the final end value to customers. You will measure the end impact against the expected outcome.

This position reports to VP, Product

Ok, you're sold, but what are we looking for in the perfect candidate?
Responsible for the success and development of the Haptik Technology Platform.
Contribute to the product vision, together with the VP of Product
Identify customer needs and develop the product solution roadmap
Take product roadmap and break them into small iterations for engineering team
Set feature prioritization with the engineering team and run sprints
Follow feature development end-to-end; provide guidance and feedback to engineers and designers; ensure everyone is aligned across sales, marketing and customer success.
Consider the business impact, ROI, and other implications when taking important decisions; performing business analysis (e.g., forecasting, pricing, economic models, etc.)
Balance new features, improvements, and bug fixes to ensure a high velocity and a stable product.
Works with customers, business teams/development, sales, marketing, legal, and other stakeholders in two-way communication as the subject-matter expert.
Contribute to related blog posts, white papers, documentation to market the product
Contribute towards improving product operations and processes to inculcate best practices and make Haptik ISO compliant.
Requirements*
Overall 8-10 years of experience across business functions
4-6 years of experience as a Product Manager in a B2B SaaS Company (preferred)
Ability to handle ambiguous situations, take decisions through data
Understand business requirements and take trade-off decisions
Strong problem solving and analytical skills to break down complex problems into smaller components
Communication experience with conveying technical topics to the audience.
Execution experience to drive multiple projects simultaneously
Experience working in startups or successful entrepreneurial adventures
Self-driven, Multi-tasker, Comfortable with a fast-paced, always-on, highly ambiguous environment.

Tell me more about Haptik
Announced major strategic partnership in April 2019 with Jio in a $100 million deal.
You will be working with great leaders who have been listed in Business World 40 Under 40, Forbes 30 Under 30 and MIT 35 Under 35 Innovators.
The freedom to think and innovate is something that defines the culture of Haptik. Every person is approachable. While we are working hard, it is also important to take breaks to not get too worked up.
Disrupting a massive, growing AI market. The global market is projected to attain a valuation of $9 billion by the end of 2024.
We are moving to an AI first world, and Haptik is one of the largest AI first companies globally, based out of India.
Some of the most notable brands in the world - Oyo Rooms, Samsung, Tata Teleservices, Club Mahindra, KFC, Coca-Cola, to count a few.
A fun and exciting start-up culture that empowers its people to make a huge impact.

Working hard for things that we don't care about is stress, but working hard for something we love is called passion! At Haptik we passionately solve problems in order to be able to move faster and each Haptikan imbibes our key values of honesty, ownership, perseverance, communication, impact, curiosity, courage, agility and selflessness.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Join a high-performing, tight-knit team at a fast-growing company that is using the Internet of Things (IoT) to transform how organizations sense, monitor, and make decisions. Founded out of MIT in 2005, SmartSense is trusted by more than 2,000 organizations, including Walmart, SpaceX, Apple, CVS Health, Coca-Cola, and the US State Department to help them make sensor-driven decisions. We have a solution that our customers rely on every day to make mission critical decisions. We are looking for team-oriented change agents to help shape the future of IoT.
Members of the Data Services team are passionate about data products, engineering data flows, storage, and enabling predictive analytics. We are inspired by data products and data services and in building and delivering tools, infrastructure, frameworks that enable insights of our business increasing the value of our data to our customers. As good stewards of our data we contribute to all aspects related to the handling of data, whether from monitoring data flows, our field sensors, PII (Personally Identifiable Information), or reflecting internal processes such as our supply chain.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
What we want to accomplish and why we need you?

Haptik is one of the world's largest Conversational AI companies, having reached over 500+ million devices, and processed over 4+ billion conversations till date. Haptik has been at the forefront of the paradigm shift of interaction from clicks to conversations. We have built a robust set of technology and tools that can enable any kind of conversational application. With a 300+ member strong team that is set to double in the coming year, Haptik is truly poised to lead the Conversational AI revolution with some of the best minds in the industry.

What will you do every day?

As a QA engineer, you will need to have a strong knowledge of testing practices and an ability to employ traditional practices in the conversational domain. You will be working in a fast-paced agile environment with a talented team of Developers and PMs. You will own the testing and quality of all new features and releases delivered by our team. You have good communication skills, pay a great deal of attention to detail and are passionate about what you do.

Ok, you're sold, but what are we looking for in the perfect candidate?
Agile experience with appropriate tooling.
Understanding of test script creation and execution and creation of test documentation and reporting.
Exposure to UI, backend, Smoke, integration, performance, Regression and mobile testing.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with distributed team members.
The ability to proactively suggest and implement process improvements that enhance the performance, productivity, and morale of the team.
The ability to work flexibly and imaginatively in a changing and evolving project environment.
Help to drive innovation and continuous improvement in bot quality management.
Should have good logical and analytical and communication skills.

Requirements*
Bachelor’s degree
4+ years of Manual and automation testing experience and at least 1-2 years of experience in Automation testing
Should have knowledge of any one of these programming languages: Python, Javascript, Java.
Must have knowledge of Automation Tools like Cypress, Selenium WebDriver
Should have knowledge of API Test Tools like Postman, Karate
Knowledge of Automation Framework would be an added advantage Cucumber, Junit, TestNG, Mocha.
Git, Jenkins
Jira
Should know basic Unix commands

Tell me more about Haptik
Announced major strategic partnership in April 2019 with Jio in a $100 million deal.
You will be working with great leaders who have been listed in Business World 40 Under 40, Forbes 30 Under 30 and MIT 35 Under 35 Innovators.
The freedom to think and innovate is something that defines the culture of Haptik. Every person is approachable. While we are working hard, it is also important to take breaks to not get too worked up.
Disrupting a massive, growing AI market. The global market is projected to attain a valuation of $9 billion by the end of 2024.
We are moving to an AI first world, and Haptik is one of the largest AI first companies globally, based out of India.
Some of the most notable brands in the world - Oyo Rooms, Samsung, Tata Teleservices, Club Mahindra, KFC, Coca-Cola, to count a few.
A fun and exciting start-up culture that empowers its people to make a huge impact.


Haptik plans to operate in a hybrid work-model where our employees will have the flexibility to Work-from-Home (WFH) for up to 3 out of 5 working days every week.
In addition to Mumbai where we already have an office, places like Bangalore, Delhi/NCR and Pune will also have an office space soon in 2022 as many of our current employees are also based in these cities.
You’re encouraged to apply only if you’re either based in one of these 4 cities (Mumbai, Bangalore ,Delhi, Pune) or are open to relocating to one within 6 months of joining us.

Working hard for things that we don't care about is stress, but working hard for something we love is called passion! At Haptik we passionately solve problems in order to be able to move faster and each Haptikan imbibes our key values of honesty, ownership, perseverance, communication, impact, curiosity, courage, agility and selflessness.

#Li-hybrid

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Customer Success Engineer
As a Customer Success Engineer at Moveworks, you’ll work alongside a Customer Success Manager to understand customer requirements and drive all technical aspects of the post-sales engagement with customers. In essence, you are responsible for the technical delivery of the Moveworks platform. This involves activities such as: validating proper access to customer infrastructure for API integrations, configuring the behavior of the Moveworks platform using configuration files, and advising customers on how they can modify their systems to optimize performance of the Moveworks platform.
You will play an advisory role to early customers, build long-term strategic relationships with both customers and partners, and ensure optimal customer experience and outcomes. Each of our team members is extremely hands-on, pushes boundaries, and is driven to deliver their best work. Because of this, you'll be the technical customer advocate internally, and have the opportunity to work closely with Product Management, Engineering and R&D teams and help to influence the product features based on feedback from customers.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Location:
Remote (USA)
About DispatchTrack
DispatchTrack is the leading solution provider of right-time delivery management software, helping top brands around the globe power successful deliveries 180 million times a year. Since 2010, DispatchTrack’s scalable SaaS platform has made delivery organizations more connected, agile, and intelligent, using highly-configurable capabilities designed to empower better delivery management from end to end. Our proprietary AI-powered routing algorithm ensures 98% ETA accuracy in last-mile deliveries. We’re constantly innovating to improve performance and better serve our 2,000+ customers, including Wal-Mart, Coca-Cola, Ashley, Ferguson Enterprises, and many others. When businesses make promises to their customers—DispatchTrack makes sure they deliver. Promise. Deliver. Delight.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
Does this sound like an interesting challenge to you - scaling and optimizing a best-in-class conversational AI product to provide instant help to all enterprise users? Do you wonder how to apply abstraction, scalability, and optimization, to a dynamic, probabilistic, and ML-driven conversational product?
If so, join us at the Conversation Engine team, where you have the opportunity to work on the heart of the Moveworks AI product, to make it scalable and optimized for the ever growing enterprise solution space. Check out our recent blog postings (part1, part2) on Moveworks’s groundbreaking solutions for enterprise AI.
As the pioneer for enterprise AI products, there’s no established formula for building out the next solution. You will be working closely with ML experts and cross-functional teams, iterating fast over innovative ideas, and making informed decisions empowered by timely user behavior data. You are challenged to scale and optimize the conversation engine to support hundreds of millions of users, omni chat channels, a large variety of ML models, and a rich set of enterprise skills, with the highest engineering quality and robustness.

Title: Data Developer
Job_Description:
As part of the Conversation Engine team, you have the opportunity to work on the very heart of the groundbreaking Conversational AI product that Moveworks is building for enterprise users. Check out our recent blog postings (part1, part2) here. You will be responsible for building out the user-facing conversation flows and skills which constitute the bridge between the latest Conversational AI framework and the customer impact!
As the pioneer for enterprise AI products, we do not have an established formula for building out the next solution - instead, you will apply your innovation and imagination on unsolved problems.
We don’t require prior experience in conversational AI products. Instead, we look for top performance in your past jobs, passion for optimizing end user facing product features, and a clear thinking framework for building a scalable and tailored user experience. You will be working closely with Machine Learning experts and cross-functional teams for the design and implementation of critical product features.This is an opportunity to play an integral role at the fastest-growing AI startup in its space.

Company Description

From concept to design to execution, be part of an innovative organization that helps transform client ideas into realities.
Do you want to impact the world around you on by providing cutting edge solutions to your clients? Does having a company care about your career today and into the future motivate you? Does an environment where your opinions matter excite you? Are you a natural born tinkerer? If so, you have found your next calling!!
Grantek is a recognized leading provider of integrated automation, smart manufacturing and industrial information solutions in the global marketplace. Our clients are some of the worlds most respected Fortune 100 companies and recognized consumer brands: GlaxoSmithKline, Brita - The Clorox Company of Canada, Molson Coors Beverage Company, Coca-Cola, Kraft Heinz, Mondelez to name a few.

Title: Client Success Manager
Job_Description:
Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home.
At Swire Coca-Cola, our commitment to excellence is what guides our actions with our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time associates which includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays and Company Discounts.

What does a Network Engineer do at Swire Coca-Cola?

In this role you are responsible for implementing, managing, and monitoring all aspects of our internal, local, wireless, wide area data and voice networks to ensure maximum uptime for systems and users. The role includes assisting in the design of network systems and configurations, documenting and managing the installation of new and existing networks, and monitoring network performance while maintaining and upgrading existing systems, as necessary.




Swire Coca-Cola, USA is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer that participates in the E-Verify program as required by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Client Success Manager
Job_Description:
Our vision is loved brands, done sustainably, for a better shared future. We strive to provide cutting-edge excellence in ingredients, innovation, design and marketing. The Principal Engineer who reports to the Engineering Director for their assigned functional area will serve as the Principal Engineer responsible to develop/manage capital strategy development and implementation for the assigned projects including product or package commercialization projects. This role will also be responsible for following the assigned project management methodology, reporting and tracking performance, schedule and cash flow of the projects and assist with technical support and leadership in beverage manufacturing systems, equipment and processes.
Location: This role is remote, but will require approximately 51-75% travel - the ideal candidate will be located near a major airport to meet this requirement

At The Coca-Cola Company, we're looking for individuals who understand the fundamentals and principles of technology and want to solve business problems on a global scale. As a Software Engineering Manager, you will lead multiple agile teams which deliver features and systems that power our next generation intelligent platforms. In this role you will have the opportunity to lead development efforts for enterprise applications, launch them, operate them, and continue to develop them. You are the leader of several engineering initiatives, driving success through your direct and indirect reports and business partners. Title: Client Success Manager
Job_Description:
Job Location: Fort Worth, TX
Work days/Shift Hours – if applicable: Sunday - Wednesday / 5:00 AM - 3:30 PM
Compensation: Up to $38.08 / hour based on experience. Additional local incentives may apply such as an extra week of pay, referral bonuses and more.
Additional Relevant Information:
General Purpose
The role of a Controls Technician is to provide competent and effective electrical and controls support to Plant operations. The ability to perform work safely, meet the needs of Operations, execute the maintenance program and comply with all safety codes such as the National Electrical Code is paramount. The Controls Technician must ensure plant electrical and control systems are installed, maintained and modified in accordance with local, state and national electrical safety codes. The Controls Technical must identify, troubleshoot and repair problems in electrical and controls wiring and programming that occur in production equipment and systems and able to work with voltages up to 600V, three-phase & single-phase A/C circuits, transformers, switchgear, and motor control centers. He/she must be able to run tests, isolate problems, replace faulty sections of wiring, and perform other tasks as necessary. He/she also performs preventive maintenance and upgrades to electronic control systems.

Title: Client Success Manager
Job_Description:
General Purpose
Provide critical thinking, in depth data analysis and workplace solutions, The role will develop and execute capital and ongoing projects, supporting processes, warehouse equipment and infrastructure, utilities, etc. to promote operational efficiency improvements, design, implement and fine tune processing, shipping & receiving, storage slotting, flows and picking operations. This role will also work with vendors to identify new or enhancements to existing facility equipment considering scope, need, volume and future state. Develop and evaluate new and existing processes and systems to efficiently use people, information, materials, and equipment. Depth knowledge in SAP logistics module.

Interroll is growing! Do you want to be part of a growing industry?
The Interroll Group is one of the world’s leading specialists within the field of internal logistics. Headquartered in Switzerland, the exchange-listed company employs around 2,300 people at 32 enterprises around the globe. Among the company’s 23,000 customers are plant manufacturers, system integrators and equipment manufacturers. Our products are in daily use by global brands everyone knows, like Amazon, Bosch, Coca-Cola, DHL, Procter & Gamble, Red Bull, Siemens, Walmart and Yamaha (Motorcycles). On top of that, Interroll initiates global research projects for logistics efficiency and is actively supporting industry associations for standards or better use of resources.
The Senior Controls Engineer is responsible for ensuring the software controls RMR (revisions, modifications, and retrofit) site project plan is executed according to scheduling and phasing. This includes system start-up coordination as well as commissioning and test coordination. This role provides interface and coordination with our customer(s) and subcontractors to resolve issues and problems to the satisfaction of the company/customer. Other responsibilities include site progress monitoring, daily PLC/HMI progress, and contribution to the team regarding risk analysis and contingency management.

Job_Description:
The Senior Accounting Research Manager will ensure that the Company’s books and records are in compliance with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and U.S. GAAP reporting requirements. Provides technical accounting guidance to the Company’s senior financial management, field operations and the Corporate center on complex business transactions. Serving as the primary accounting point of contact for all operations (including bottling) for the countries within the assigned geography.
What You Will Do for Us:
Determine the appropriate accounting treatment for complex accounting issues and provide guidance to field financial management/financial services on how to properly apply the treatment. Prepare written communications documenting the Company’s position for the Company’s files and for the external auditors.
Review/approve requests for authorization (RFAs) in order to identify any underlying accounting issues and to determine the appropriate treatment.
Financial Management; Consulting; Financial Statements; Accounting Research; organization; Financial Analysis and Reporting; Accounting; Project Management; Communication; Oral Communications; People Management; Written Communication; GAAP Financial Reporting; Process Improvements; Detail-Oriented; Technical Accounting

Title: Director - Data Engineering & Analytics
Job_Description:
Who You’ll Work With
You will work in Data & Analytics Technologies organization that is responsible for building cloud-based analytics products for APAC, EMEA, Americas and Corporate that directly impacts Coca-Cola’s business growth globally.
What You’ll Do
This role, reporting to Head of Data Engineering will drive the development of data pipelines, warehouses and marts for key subject areas based on annual objectives. This role will work cross functionally with Data Services organization, Product management, Data Governance, and engineers to understand data requirements and implement an enterprise-grade data products.

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description
As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to translate prototypes into scalable solutions. You will build, ship, run and monitor Coca-Cola’s global ML & AI solutions bridging the gap between Data Scientists and Operations. You will ensure that models conform to the ML strategy and guidance established by the Coca-Cola Data Science team. You should be proficient at building, training, deploying, and monitoring ML models on the Azure platform including Azure Machine Learning service and Synapse.
Responsibilities for Senior Data Engineer
Wrap models in a scoring function for an API or a scheduled batch run, wrapping a model in a simple web interface, ensuring appropriate logging for monitoring/observability, crafting documentation for HLA and API specs, configuring Docker/Kubernetes, etc.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Job_Description:
Position Overview:
The SAP Master data Analyst - Solution Delivery Lead is accountable for managing the project design, delivery and deployment of solution related to all master data relevant to support Supply chain process area right from Purchasing, Manufacturing, Sales, Quality , Plant maintenance , warehouse , Transport management & Finance data to close the settlement activity.
At this moment the Coca-Cola Company is implementing the SAP S/4 Hana solution globally in all Business entities, including Concentrate, Bottlers, Copackers and Flavor manufacturing. Each deployment requires the evaluation and development of plant specific solutions in relation to Master data processes and downstream integration for data transfer to support process continuity. The Master data are unique to each plant configuration and require proper maintenance to support S/4 solutions deployment
Business Requirements; Structured Query Language (SQL); Collaborative Leadership; Troubleshooting; Software Development; Systems Analysis; Project Management; Workflows; Agile Methodologies; Data Analysis; Query Language; Microsoft Office; Communication; Configuring; Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC); Information Systems; Computer Programming; Business Processing

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
The Coca-Cola Company is looking for a Senior Analyst to analyze, interpret, and create meaningful visualizations of data. As part of the North America Digital Services team, you will enable our partners to make decision with connected data solutions and establish metrics that drive business outcomes. The Senior Analyst will be part of a team that uses data to tell a story and visually organize information to better identify future growth opportunities in the market. We are looking for someone who is passionate about turning large volumes of data into simple business insights. You are comfortable learning quickly and connecting the dots between different data types and sources and explain the essential insights to business users, minimize complexity, and focus on results. This position requires a high-energy, motivated individual with strong visualization skills, analytical skills, and excellent communication skills. A team-player attitude is crucial, valuing collaboration, curiosity, purpose, and diversity which are part of our culture and critical to our success.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Job_Description:
Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home.
At Swire Coca-Cola, our commitment to excellence is what guides our actions with our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time associates which includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays and Company Discounts.

What does a Research Analyst do at Swire Coca-Cola?

With a worldwide brand recognition and an extremely competitive landscape, making everybody smarter than our competition in our organization is key to company health and growth. Data can improve every part of the company, from supply chain & delivery efficiencies to employee retention and attracting the right talent. The purpose of the Enterprise Research & Analytics team is to create data that is easier to consume and use throughout the organization while also keeping a finger on the pulse of our market, consumers, and future. The Research Analyst position will assist with the wide variety of tasks that help us make the organization smarter and more efficient. The right candidate will express extreme curiosity, insatiable desire to learn, inquisitive, analytical, excellent communication of complex or technical topics, ability to translate ambiguity to executable tasks, ability to prioritize initiatives based on ROI



Swire Coca-Cola, USA is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer that participates in the E-Verify program as required by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.

What does a Data Governance Analyst do at Swire Coca-Cola?

Our Data Governance Analyst will execute data policies and standards to ensure accuracy, quality of data through all upstream, and downstream data channels. Update, delete and add any Enterprise Master Data records per governance framework. Ensures all creation and modification of data records is done appropriately and provides the expertise throughout Swire for reporting and data. Designs and creates extracts, develops interfaces and data sources by monitoring and reconciling. Runs daily, weekly, period end reporting.

What does a Shopper Marketing Analyst do at Swire Coca-Cola?
The Shopper Marketing department develops dynamic shopper experiences which drive targeted business growth for Swire Coca-Cola and our partner retailers. The Shopper Marketing Analyst provides the data insights and market trends for the team in order to develop data driven strategies to win in the highly competitive beverage industry. Within this team there is a need for a resourceful, proactive individual who can support these marketing initiatives as a data analyst. The individual in this role will develop an expertise of the beverage market, 1st & 3rd party data sources, and retail strategy. The tools developed in this role will serve as an excellent foundation to build a career at Swire Coca-Cola.
